channel.description: Better nannying for North Carolina starts here!

item.title: 2021 interNational Nanny Training Day and SARS-2
item.dc:creator: NC PAN Webmaster
item.description: Because we are still battling CoViD-19 and some places are heading into additional lockdowns while there are also group gathering restrictions still in place, the official international stance on interNational Nanny Training Day is to hold an entirely virtual/online asynchronous training day this year (April 17th; this Saturday). In addition, there will be a group […]
item.content:encoded:
Because we are still battling CoViD-19 and some places are heading into additional lockdowns while there are also group gathering restrictions still in place, the official international stance on interNational Nanny Training Day is to hold an entirely virtual/online asynchronous training day this year (April 17th; this Saturday). In addition, there will be a group live-stream on 17th April 2021 if OnDemand (asynchronous) doesn’t work for you. The asynchronous recordings will be available until 2nd May 2021. Plus, registered attendees will have access to a private Facebook group with additional content.

Secure your ticket @ https://nannypalooza.regfox.com/international-nanny-training-day-inntd

Learn more details @ https://www.nannypalooza.com/nntd.html

item.title: Employment Verification Letter for Nanny Vaccines
item.dc:creator: NC PAN Webmaster
item.description: Nannies have been eligible for vaccination since Wednesday and we can now confirm that most counties, pharmacies, and hospital systems are vaccinating nannies; the hold outs are still in Group 2 and have nothing to do with nannies, specifically. We have heard minor, isolated, incidents of uninformed individuals who “aren’t sure if nannies qualify”. Don’t […]
item.content:encoded:
Nannies have been eligible for vaccination since Wednesday and we can now confirm that most counties, pharmacies, and hospital systems are vaccinating nannies; the hold outs are still in Group 2 and have nothing to do with nannies, specifically.

We have heard minor, isolated, incidents of uninformed individuals who “aren’t sure if nannies qualify”. Don’t back down under a challenge like this; nannies ARE eligible and any person challenging this benefits from checking so as to learn to better serve the public. Most of the ignorance comes from not realizing that nannying is a full time profession different from occasionally babysitting. We experienced nannies are no strangers to this misconception.

In the event that you don’t want to have to be an ambassador for the profession and fear you will find yourself in one of these isolated moments of push back, you can have your employers fill out an employment verification letter found here

Nanny Vaccine LetterDownload

Please let us know of any entities that are vaccinating Group 3 who are denying nannies, even after seeing the letter or checking their facts, by dropping a comment. We will be happy to educate them so all nannies benefit.

item.title: COVID Vaccination for the Nanny
item.dc:creator: Jennifer Levenbook
item.description: As some of you who already follow our Facebook page may have seen, nannies are slated to receive the vaccine in Phase 1b, Subgroup Group 3: Childcare Workers. This is where we are planned for and this is where we need to be showing up. According to Governor Cooper, we are already in Phase 1b. […]
item.content:encoded:
As some of you who already follow our Facebook page may have seen, nannies are slated to receive the vaccine in Phase 1b, Subgroup Group 3: Childcare Workers. This is where we are planned for and this is where we need to be showing up.

According to Governor Cooper, we are already in Phase 1b.

According to Senator Jackson, we should expect vaccinations to start on the 24th of February.

The vaccination delivery is being done on a county-by-county basis even though as a state it was decided where nannies place into the groupings and subgroupings and even though as a state it was decided that we are in Phase 1b. To illustrate this, at the time of writing this post, Wake County has announced to its county residents that it is still in Phase 1a despite the Governor due to supply shortages. So it is all a big mess.

We here at your North Carolina Professional Association of Nannies hope to provide an informational clearing house about this vaccination extravaganza of confusion. We cannot do this alone. If you know what your county is up to, please let your local nanny community know and also please let us know so that we can add it to this post for any nannies who haven’t been connected with your local community yet. How to let us know? Leave a comment.

Here is what we know (in alphabetical order of county):

Durham County

This link will tell you what phase they’re on and you’re in. When you’re eligible you call and make an appointment.

We have heard that they are requiring employers to call and make appointments for employee nannies, so prepare your employer for this duty should it become necessary.

Franklin County

Use their online vaccination scheduling portal.

Granville County

252-295-1503 Call that number.

Orange County

A multi-step process which starts by filling out a survey to indicate that you are interested and to assess how you qualify. Start HERE and they’ll email you next steps. Say yes to the survey page that asks about Phase 1b and then yes again to the survey page that asks about childcare workers.

Rutherford County

Despite the timeline set by Governor Cooper, it appears this county is still in Group 2 and hasn’t expanded to Group 3. When this happens it is usually due to short supply. Put yourself on the waiting list, here.

Vance County

252-295-1503 Call that number.

Wake County

A multi-step process which starts by filling out a survey to indicate that you are interested and to assess how you qualify. Start HERE.

We are “those who work in child care”.

In addition, there is a number to call if the online system isn’t working.

Hospital systems and pharmacies are also independently vaccinating in parallel with county health departments. Here is what we know about those (in alphabetical order):

Neighbor Health

Located in Raleigh. Services provided through the UNC Hospitals system. Sign up through this link.

UNC Healthcare

Visit this link. They open new appointment slots daily at ~ 1pm through the UNC MyChart portal.

item.title: Should I Ask for a COVID Raise? A Chat.
item.dc:creator: NC PAN Webmaster
item.description: From Lora Brawley of Nanny Care Hub comes a Zoom chat on whether or not, and how, ask for a COVID raise. We’ll let her take it from here: In the beginning of the pandemic, lots of nannies picked up extra duties because the nation was on stay-at-home orders and often, they were the only […]
item.content:encoded:
From Lora Brawley of Nanny Care Hub comes a Zoom chat on whether or not, and how, ask for a COVID raise. We’ll let her take it from here:

In the beginning of the pandemic, lots of nannies picked up extra duties because the nation was on stay-at-home orders and often, they were the only professional allowed in the house. Housekeepers, dog walkers, chefs, and others were asked to stay at home. Schools and preschools closed and all of a sudden, they were in charge of virtual learning too. Most nannies didn’t ask for a raise during that time because people assumed (hoped!) it was temporary. However now we know we’re not going back to “normal” and many nannies are trying to figure out how their new responsibilities and work environments affect their hourly wage and benefits. Join me as we unpack this issue and talk about the if, when, how, and how much of a COVID raise.

Email Announcing Event

You may choose to attend this event in person, or a recording of the event will be provided 24 hours after the chat. The same registration is required for both.

The event will take place on Saturday July 12th starting at 8 pm ET.

Register HERE

item.title: Make Group Calls More Comfortable
item.dc:creator: NC PAN Webmaster
item.description: This stay-home experience has a lot more of us on a lot more video chats. But there’s always that one person with the background noise that makes the video chat difficult to follow. Don’t be that person. And even better, don’t be that person FOR FREE! And here is A REFERRAL LINK for 1 month […]
item.content:encoded:
This stay-home experience has a lot more of us on a lot more video chats. But there’s always that one person with the background noise that makes the video chat difficult to follow. Don’t be that person. And even better, don’t be that person FOR FREE!

And here is A REFERRAL LINK for 1 month of Free Pro for being a supporting member! You get 1 free month and the NC PAN account gets 1 free month at no extra charge to anyone.

GET BONUS VIA REFERRAL LINK

If you don’t want the bonus or make it a general rule never to use affiliate or referral links, you can find the service which provides 120 minutes of background noise elimination per month on the free plan at https://krisp.ai/.

item.title: Job Hunting in a Pandemic
item.dc:creator: NC PAN Webmaster
item.description: From Lora Brawley of Nanny Care Hub comes a paid webinar on how to job hunt during a pandemic. We’ll let her take it from here: If you’re one of the many nannies that are currently looking for a job or will be in the next 12 to 18 months, this session is designed especially […]
item.content:encoded:
From Lora Brawley of Nanny Care Hub comes a paid webinar on how to job hunt during a pandemic. We’ll let her take it from here:

If you’re one of the many nannies that are currently looking for a job or will be in the next 12 to 18 months, this session is designed especially for you.  COVID-19 has turned our industry upside down.  Caregivers from other segments of the childcare industry are entering the nanny field increasing competition, families are unsure of their childcare needs but they know they need help, new nanny skills are suddenly in demand, and families are looking for help in navigating how to safely bring help into their homes.

Sign Up Page

Cost for this webinar is $35 firm, regardless of ability to pay, so if you are unable to afford the $35 due to job hunting during the pandemic, please contact learn@ncpan.org to see if we can help offset the cost.

The event will take place on Saturday May 9th from noon to 3 pm ET.

SIGN UP HERE

item.title: Public Schools Suspended for Remainder of School Year
item.dc:creator: NC PAN Webmaster
item.description: Governor Roy Cooper gave a press conference today (Friday, April 24th) at lunch time. He said a lot of things, but only one that related to nannies and it is: Public schools are all the way out for the whole rest of the school year. For those of you with school aged charges, we know […]
item.content:encoded:
Governor Roy Cooper gave a press conference today (Friday, April 24th) at lunch time. He said a lot of things, but only one that related to nannies and it is:

Public schools are all the way out for the whole rest of the school year.

For those of you with school aged charges, we know that adding Governess to your nanny title wasn’t something you wanted forced upon you, and especially not without additional pay. We get it. So if you haven’t seen the mental health resources for nannies in this trying time, take ample advantage of them. You deserve it.

In addition, fire up your ongoing draft copy of your resume and RIGHT NOW add Governess to your position title at your current position. It is what you are doing.

governess (noun) — a woman who is employed to take charge of a child’s upbringing, education, etc.

Dictionary.com

Like it or hate it, we’ve just gained ourselves a resume booster because that “education” piece has fallen to us. So capture it before it gets forgotten and immortalize it on that resume!

item.title: (triad) Free Hand Sanitizer
item.dc:creator: NC PAN Webmaster
item.description: Triad nannies, especially those of you in Greensboro, go get your essential working selves some personal protective hand sanitizer … free! Hat tip to Nanny Michelle W for making us aware of this awesome offer from Fainting Goat Spirits. Make sure you click the button on Facebook to “embiggen” the image as it is longer than […]
item.content:encoded:
Triad nannies, especially those of you in Greensboro, go get your essential working selves some personal protective hand sanitizer … free!

Hat tip to Nanny Michelle W for making us aware of this awesome offer from Fainting Goat Spirits.

Make sure you click the button on Facebook to “embiggen” the image as it is longer than Facebook’s image preview. More information to read.

item.title: Nanny Karaoke
item.dc:creator: Jennifer Levenbook
item.description: Sunday, 3 May 2020 @ 3-6 pm CT / 4-7 pm ET. —— LEARN MORE Thanks to the existence of COVID-19, Ask the Nanny is putting together a monthly Sunday social. The past two months, the social has been karaoke. And who doesn’t like to sing? Or at least hear others sing beautifully? The cost […]
item.content:encoded:
Sunday, 3 May 2020 @ 3-6 pm CT / 4-7 pm ET. —— LEARN MORE

Thanks to the existence of COVID-19, Ask the Nanny is putting together a monthly Sunday social. The past two months, the social has been karaoke. And who doesn’t like to sing? Or at least hear others sing beautifully? The cost is free.

Bring your props, wigs, weaves, boas, hats, instruments and anything else that will transform you into “EVERY WOMAN”.

It’s time for some “I’m Every Woman” Karaoke. Sing your favorite female hits from the last three decades.

Event Description
CLICK HERE TO REGISTER

If you do not have Facebook, you can still register by sending an email to thenanny@atnanny.com.

Cannot attend this Sunday Social? Follow Ask the Nanny on Facebook to be aware of all future Sunday Socials, or simply keep an eye on our NC Nanny Calendar as all events NC Nannies can attend will be included.

item.title: Team Trivia / Pub Quiz
item.dc:creator: NC PAN Webmaster
item.description: Thursday, 30 August 2020 @ 7 pm ET. LEARN MORE Who is in the mood for some socially-distanced team trivia with a delightful Scottish burr? We are going to get together and as a team, figure out the answers to a pub quiz being brought to us from Scotland. We’ll submit an answer sheet and […]
item.content:encoded:
Thursday, 30 August 2020 @ 7 pm ET. LEARN MORE

Who is in the mood for some socially-distanced team trivia with a delightful Scottish burr?

We are going to get together and as a team, figure out the answers to a pub quiz being brought to us from Scotland. We’ll submit an answer sheet and see how we compare with the entire rest of the world!

On our honor, we are not to use the search engines, but answer from what we know. We are nannies of honor.

SIGN UP AND JOIN IN

As always, if you do not have Facebook, send an email to webmaster@ncpan.org for registration.
